descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Not just a political history of the past seven decades, this course focuses on the essential questions of politics and social change - who wins and who loses, who exercises power over whom and how - in China from 1949 to the present. With a focus on watershed events, ongoing debates and struggles, and core choices in the management of economic development and social upheaval, students will gain an understanding of Chinese politics that is both broad and deep, with details and nuances linked strongly to over-arching themes and issues.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will acquire a thorough knowledge of political and social issues and events in China since 1949, they will also become familiar with - and have some opportunity to think critically about - some of the debates and controversies around contemporary issues in Chinese politics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Best 6 of 7 in-class quizzes: 30% (5% each); Participation in Discussion Sections: 30%; Final Exam: 40%

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
